728416f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Engert Street
728416f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, at Engert Street, showing the
Rossville Hook and Ladder Company of the New York City Fire Department.
April 22, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
728416f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Engert Street, Staten Island, NY

728417f-c.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Engert Street
728417f-c.text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, south side, west of Engert Street.
The house belonged to Lydia Winant in 1898, and to Mary L.
Dissosway from 1907 to 1917. Dates refer to maps on which
the owners' names appear.
September 19, 1925
P.L.Sperr
(2)
The same, at a later date, looking east.
April 30, 1929
P.L.Sperr
(3)
The same as view 2.
May 5, 1937
P.L.Sperr
728417f-c.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Engert Street, Staten Island, NY

728418f-b.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Engert Street
728418f-b.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, about 150 fegt west
of Engert Street, showing C'Neill's Family Resort. The
real estate maps from 1899 to 1917 show it to have been knowh
as the Rossville Hotel. The Rossville Post Office was located
here in 1874 (Beers's map).
September 19, 1925
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A rear view of the house.fron the Arthur Kill
shore.
,September 19, 1925
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A front view at a later date.
October 6, 1928
P. L. Sperr
728418f-b.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Engert Street, Staten Island, NY
